changed."},"BeaconUpgraded(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the beacon is changed."},"Initialized(uint8)":{"details":"Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized."},"RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted signaling this. _Available since v3.1._"},"RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call, an admin role bearer except when using {AccessControl-_setupRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"},"Upgraded(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the implementation is upgraded."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"approveSpeedup(uint256)":{"params":{"_proposalId":"ID of the proposal being sped up"}},"approveVeto(uint256)":{"params":{"_proposalId":"ID of the proposal being vetoed"}},"constructor":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow":"constructor"},"executeSpeedup(uint256)":{"params":{"_proposalId":"ID of the proposal being sped up"}},"executeVeto(uint256)":{"params":{"_proposalId":"ID of the proposal being vetoed"}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"getSpeedupParams(uint256)":{"params":{"_proposalId":"ID of the proposal"},"returns":{"newTimelockDelay":"Reduced timelock delay","newVotingPeriod":"Reduced voting period"}},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasApprovedSpeedup(uint256,address)":{"params":{"_member":"Council member address","_proposalId":"Proposal ID"},"returns":{"_0":"bool True if approved"}},"hasApprovedVeto(uint256,address)":{"params":{"_member":"Council member address","_proposalId":"Proposal ID"},"returns":{"_0":"bool True if approved"}},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"initialize(address,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"_admin":"Address that will have admin role","_requiredApprovals":"Number of approvals needed for council actions","_speedupVotingPeriod":"Duration council has to vote on speedup","_vetoPeriod":"Duration proposals can be vetoed after passing","_vetoVotingPeriod":"Duration council has to vote on veto"}},"initiateSpeedup(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"_newTimelockDelay":"Reduced timelock delay in seconds","_newVotingPeriod":"Reduced voting period in seconds","_proposalId":"ID of the proposal to speedup"}},"initiateVeto(uint256)":{"params":{"_proposalId":"ID of the proposal to veto"}},"isSpedup(uint256)":{"params":{"_proposalId":"ID of the proposal"},"returns":{"_0":"bool True if speedup executed"}},"isVetoed(uint256)":{"params":{"_proposalId":"ID of the proposal"},"returns":{"_0":"bool True if vetoed and executed"}},"proxiableUUID()":{"details":"Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"setRequiredApprovals(uint256)":{"params":{"_newRequiredApprovals":"New threshold"}},"setSpeedupVotingPeriod(uint256)":{"params":{"_newSpeedupVotingPeriod":"New speedup voting period in seconds"}},"setVetoPeriod(uint256)":{"params":{"_newVetoPeriod":"New veto period in seconds"}},"setVetoVotingPeriod(uint256)":{"params":{"_newVetoVotingPeriod":"New veto voting period in seconds"}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See {IERC165-supportsInterface}."},"upgradeTo(address)":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow-reachable":"delegatecall","details":"Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event."},"upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes)":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow-reachable":"delegatecall","details":"Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event."}},"title":"GovernanceCouncil","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"COUNCIL_ADMIN_ROLE()":{"notice":"Role for managing council params._proposalId: ID of the proposal being sped up
ID of the proposal being vetoed
ID of the proposal being sped up
ID of the proposal being vetoed

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

params._admin: Address that will have admin role
params._requiredApprovals: Number of approvals needed for council actions
params._speedupVotingPeriod: Duration council has to vote on speedup
params._vetoPeriod: Duration proposals can be vetoed after passing
params._vetoVotingPeriod: Duration council has to vote on veto

params._proposalId: ID of the proposal to speedup
ID of the proposal to veto

returns._0: bool True if vetoed and executed

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params._newSpeedupVotingPeriod: New speedup voting period in seconds

params._newVetoVotingPeriod: New veto voting period in seconds

upgradeTo(address).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

COUNCIL_MEMBER_ROLE().notice: Role for council members who can vote on council actions

executeSpeedup(uint256).notice: Execute a speedup action once threshold is reached

executeVeto(uint256).notice: Execute a veto action once threshold is reached

getSpeedupParams(uint256).notice: Get speedup parameters for a proposal

hasApprovedSpeedup(uint256,address).notice: Check if an address has approved a speedup

hasApprovedVeto(uint256,address).notice: Check if an address has approved a veto

initiateSpeedup(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Initiate a speedup action for a proposal

initiateVeto(uint256).notice: Initiate a veto action for a proposal

isSpedup(uint256).notice: Check if a proposal has been sped up

isVetoed(uint256).notice: Check if a proposal has been vetoed

requiredApprovals().notice: Minimum number of approvals required for council actions

speedupActions(uint256).notice: Mapping of proposal ID to speedup action

speedupVotingPeriod().notice: Duration in seconds that a speedup action is valid for voting

vetoActions(uint256).notice: Mapping of proposal ID to veto action

vetoPeriod().notice: Duration in seconds that a proposal can be vetoed after passing

vetoVotingPeriod().notice: Duration in seconds that a veto action is valid for voting
